job_title: Adjunct Professor in Garden City, NY
pros: Freedom to create and teach
cons: Difficult parking and using lunch room higher pay higher pay and benefits keep up with inflation .

job_title: Clerk in Garden City, NY
pros: Great Benefit Great co workers
cons: extremely unorganized No direction or promotions

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Garden City, NY
pros: The working environment and co-workers are excellent.
cons: Lack of job advancement opportunity is the biggest challenge.

job_title: Public Safety Officer in New York, NY
pros: good to work for very
cons: work can get boring at times

review_title: Great environment. Hard to work full time.
job_title: Adjunct Instructor in Garden City, NY
pros: Nassau has a great set of kids. It also has a high hourly wage and some minimal benefits.
cons: It’s hard to get a full-time position.

job_title: Student Aide in Garden City, NY
pros: It helped pay for my education which was already cheap as it was.
cons: The Administration dissolved the department I worked in.

job_title: Interlibrary Loan Student Assistant in Garden City, NY
pros: Customer Service Experience. Also worked with Interlibrary Loan system.
cons: Not much relationship with clients.

review_title: Terrible place to work for an administrator
job_title: Systems Administrator in Garden City Park, NY
pros: Great benefits and beautiful campus.
cons: The administration is divided into two groups; management confidential admins and the unionized admins. The management confidential admins treat the unionized admins terribly. The General Counsel and other executive level management convinced the rest of the administrators to form a union because we had not seen an increase in six years. As soon as the PREB broke us into two groups, they gave themselves an increase and 14 months later, a second increase. The unionized administrators have not seen an increase in 10+ years and now the College is trying to break up the union they cajoled us into creating.

review_title: Can be okay for some people.
job_title: Grant Director in Garden City, NY
pros: The county offers great benefits.
cons: They will not hesitate to lay you off for reasons that have nothing to do with performance. There is fiscal mismanagement and rather than fix it at the top, they will willingly forfeit funding - even if it leaves themselves out of compliance - and do mass layoffs to save themselves from fiscal accountability. It’s a complete anomaly in the SUNY system.

job_title: Cashier in Port Washington, NY
pros: Very good place to work at
cons: I have no cons to speak of

job_title: Public Information Representative in Lindenhurst, NY
pros: great staff, great school, great boss
cons: none at all. loved the place

job_title: Professor in New York, NY
pros: they are looking to improve
cons: they are not measurably improving

job_title: Typist Clerk in Uniondale, NY
pros: Strong union that gets their members what they can; After 10 years, there was no more contributions to health insurance (I don't know if they still have that, but no one else does !!!). The union got small bonuses for the people for college credits, reimburse a portion of out of pocket prescription costs; gave a holiday party.
cons: The epitome of waste and corruption is found here. Most of the typists I met had literally nothing to do. Most people get their own phone, make their own copies, answer their own e-mail. I begged the professors for work to do; I was so bored; forced to listen to the professors' latest vacation, travel, purchases.  The professors are grossly overpaid for maybe 12-17 hour schedule; the adjuncts never get paid due to 6 six little old ladies sitting in a room doing payroll with a calculator and hand written time sheets. The professors are obnoxious and will kill each other over "the list" of who has the most seniority. I witnessed some very bad, catty behavior. Also, the professors stole reams of paper!

job_title: in Garden City, NY
pros: Nassau Community College has friendly community, the pay is very good, and the work is really easy.  There are different shifts and hours available for work, which makes it easy for people to work and study, or work full time and part at place, and easily fit schedule.
cons: For part time technical assistants, it is hard to get full 20 hours as hours are given according to semester seniority.  There aren’t any special benefits for college employees such as discount in tuition, etc.  More important, college has now changed its rule that college employees are not allowed to take any courses for personal enrichment, if they are taking any classes, then they have to work as student aide for minimum wage.

review_title: Working as a Student Aide was flexible and school work friendly.
job_title: Student Aide in Garden City, NY
pros: As a student Aide, the hours you get are considerate of your school work. Working in the same environment you learn has advantages such as easy access to your professors and constant reminders of on coming projects.
cons: Sometimes as a student you would like to get away from the learning environment for a break but as a Student Aide that is barely an option during your working hours.

job_title: Student Assistant in Garden City, NY
pros:
-lots of free study/down time

-Great opportunity to learn about professors and their life experiences

-free food brought by the professors or from working in school conferences
cons:
-dealing with "interesting" students/callers; NCC attracts weird people who may call more than once on a settled request

-internal conflicts reaching uncomfortable levels of tension; budget planning can be divisive at times

-cold, uninsulated floors; they freeze your feet in the winter

job_title: Adjunct Instructor, English in Garden City, NY
pros: I love it here. Yes, there are politics and disagreements but so much better than the trend at many local private universities where factions exist between English and Composition departments (and Comp is treated like the ugly step-sister).
cons: Tough to get in full time & lots of flux in the administration the past few years.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Uniondale, NY
pros: Had fun, good people in my department and extra time enough ot do homework while I work. Very convienent to be able to have a job on campus.
cons: Need to sit all the professors down and tell them to treat students better. Some of them actred very angry all the time and treated us like inferiors.

job_title: Administrator in Garden City, NY
pros:
The network is vast and wide.
The diversity and inclusion of the stakeholders provides lessons in cultural competency. The lessons learned are transformative.
cons:
You'll love it here, and that comfort zone could make one complacent.
The diversity and inclusionary preached is not  practiced. numbers don't lie!

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in Garden City, NY
pros: Not many hours are required, best paid SUNY school. Small classes, most students are really interested in the topic. A lot of freedom.
cons: Lack of available full time positions. Equipment is very outdated, as are the buildings. Politics are annoying...if someone needs to change a class time for a valid reason, do it.

job_title: Student Worker in Garden City, NY
pros: Your boss is there to help you succeed, not just in your work, but in your studies. My boss made sure I always had time to ace my midterms and finals, while still getting work done.
cons: You'll only be able to work up to 30 hours, but it's not a problem.

job_title: IT Help Desk in Garden City, NY
pros: It’s great real world experience if you want to work in the IT field in the future.
cons: It’s very tiring having to walk all around campus to help facially members with computer issues. On or after classes.

review_title:
So sad... This place has so
Much going for it...
job_title: Lab Technician in Garden City, NY
pros: Easy work. No need for overtime
cons: No full time lines. The college is getting cheap with hiring.

job_title: Helpdesk Technician in Garden City, NY
pros: I was able to gain experience in my field, which is Information Technology. My associates was in Computer Repair Technology.
cons: - degrading amount of pay - lack of communication - politically driven environment - folks on the bottom of the food  chain end up dealing with the messes from upper management

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Garden City, NY
pros: The students are great. The administration is very supportive
cons: No health insurance or benefits

review_title: It is a great place to work
job_title: Assistant Professor in Garden City, NY
pros: Great staff and training! good benefits and pension plan
cons: Poor management from adiministration. terrible leadership of new president.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Long Island City, NY
pros: You do not need to publish although if you do it is a plus.
cons: It is an open admission institution.

job_title: Physics Lab Assistant in Garden City, NY
pros: Kind proffesors who help you learn what you need to know. Awesome challenging assignments.
cons: None for me or anyone I worked with

job_title: Maintenance Carpenter in East Garden City, NY
pros: Absolute best place to learn new maintenance techniques
cons: Unfortunately the work environment is plagued by unmotivated employees.

job_title: Lab Technician in Garden City, NY
pros: Amazing people, amazing pay and amazing benefits
cons: hard to get a full time line

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Garden City, NY
pros: A wonderful community college that enabled vast discovery of various subjects
cons: Facilities were under established and were not well funded.

pros: easy and good for the resumé
cons: not much as long as you do your job
